meanings.definition: The practice of using aggressive or questionable sales tactics.
meanings.sent1: The hucksterism of the salesman made customers feel pressured.
meanings.sent2: Her success in sales was due to her energetic hucksterism.
meanings.sent3: The hucksterism of the street vendor was so over-the-top, it made people laugh.
meanings.sent4: The politician's hucksterism in promising everything to everyone was transparent.
meanings.sent5: The hucksterism of the infomercial was hard to resist, despite knowing better.

meanings.definition: The act of promoting or selling goods in an aggressive or showy manner.
meanings.sent1: The company's hucksterism in advertising led to increased sales.
meanings.sent2: The flashy hucksterism of the product launch caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The hucksterism of the carnival barker drew crowds with its flair.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, hucksterism plays a big role in marketing trends.
meanings.sent5: The hucksterism of the auctioneer made even the mundane seem exciting.
